quizzes.title: History Quiz: Leprechauns and Leprechaun
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, actor, quorum. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Pick out the word that means a type of person.
A quorum has to do with a group of  which of these?
Once leprechauns were described as creatures dressed in red.
100 million valentines are estimated to be given out in February in honor of Valentines Day.
According to legend, a leprechaun must tell the truth if looked directly in the eye.
Which of these words is associated with clothing?
According to Greek mythology, this god is responsible for lust, love and sex.
In the old days, in order to keep leprechauns content, Irish people used to leave out a dish of what?
Which popular NBA team has a logo, featuring a leprechaun?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Boston Celtics

questions.question: Cupid appears in the movie Toothless and is portrayed by actor Richard Chamberlain.
What kind of creature is the leprechaun in Irish mythology?
In ancient Athens, one day per week was sacred to Eros.
There are female leprechauns.
What is the traditional craft practiced by leprechauns according to Irish mythology?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: making shoes

questions.question: February 14 is the day set aside for Valentines Day, the day celebrating love.

quizzes.title: Nature Quiz: Words and Word
quizzes.description: Test your nature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Nature, judge, clemency. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Pick out the name of the king of Persia from either 519-465 B.C. or 486-465 B.C.?
Tellurium is a metallic element of this color combination.
Pick the word that means annoyance at ones own failures or errors.
Zoroastrianism refers to which of the following?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: a type of religion

questions.question: Pick the word that does NOT mean conversation.
Which one of these words means pleased or satisfied with oneself?
Which of these words means having an insatiable appetite?
Which of these words can be defined as an expert critical judge of art?
Which of these animals can be a wrasse?
The word umbilicus refers to what part of the human body?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: the navel

questions.question: Which one of these words means to recover after a sickness?
The word yurt is similar in meaning to which of these words?
Which of these words means to guess?
Does the word clemency mean the state of being a huge Mark Twain fan?
Which of these words means panic?

quizzes.title: Nature Quiz: Love and Obsessive Love
quizzes.description: Test your nature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Nature, trichophilia, sinophile. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This is an obsessive love of cats.
Of course there is a word for an obsessive love of peanut butter sticking to the roof of your mouth. Which one is it?
Find the word that does NOT mean to hold back.
What is cyberphilia?

options.text: An obsessive love of the Internet

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: An obsessive love of the Internet

questions.question: What do we call an obsessive love of being ridiculed?
What is  cenophilia ?

options.text: An obsessive love of being dirty
An obsessive love of empty spaces
An obsessive love of animal fur skins

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: An obsessive love of empty spaces

questions.question: For which culture does a Sinophile have an obsessive love?
Philhellenism is an obsessive love of which culture?
This is an obsessive love of walking.
The word centimeter means one hundred meters.
Which of these phrases can mean fashionable?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: a la mode

questions.question: For what does a lygophile have an obsessive love?
What is the term for obsessive love of wild animals?
Trichophilia is an obsessive love of what ?
This is an obsessive love of  clowns.

quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Phrase and Word
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, cafe, mean. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Literally (not figuratively), what does the word adieu mean?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: to God

questions.question: Which phrase refers to love of life?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: joie de vivre

questions.question: What is an aperitif?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: a before meal drink

questions.question: Cafe au lait is an outdoor cafe.
Which phrase can mean feat of strength?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: tour de force

questions.question: What if you wanted to be the mayor of your town?   What would that profession be called in Spanish?
What does the word coquette mean?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: a flirtatious girl

questions.question: What is the literal translation of vis-a-vis?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: face to face

questions.question: Youre 5 years old.   Your mommy asks you what you want to be when you grow up.  You say I wanna be a cowboy.  How would you say cowboy in Spanish?
My dad is an avid fisherman.  If he were a Spanish fisherman, what would his profession be called?
In Spanish, what would you be called if you were a fireman?
What does blase mean?
Suppose you wanted to study law and become a lawyer.   The word for lawyer in Spanish is _______________.
How about if you become a baker?  In Spanish, you would be called a what?
The definition of the phrase, cause celebre, is an issue arousing widespread controversy or heated public debate.

quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, judge, espejo. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Now give me the English word for the Spanish word espejo.

options.text: A bone of the inner ear

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A type of lottery

questions.question: How do you translate cuchara from Spanish to English?

Your father was a cobbler. Your grandfather was a cobbler. Your great grandfather was a cobbler.  Chances are you may become a cobbler too.  What would the Spanish word for cobbler be?

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Person and Word
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, college, creatures. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Tomentum is a word describing the increase in speed of a rolling object which is then accelerated e.g. kicking a soccer ball

What is the term for a person responsible for devising a new machine or a new process of doing something?
In Greek mythology, Sirens often led sailors to their deaths with their beautiful songs.
Someone who entertains by pretending to be someone else, usually either in a play or through film products.
Which Tom played Dr Who in the cult BBC television series?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tom Baker

questions.question: How do we call someone that does detective work?
How do we call a person who takes on a new identity in order to deceive?
What is another word for tome?
A university or college teacher is known as a professor.
A Tom Collins is a long drink consisting of vodka, lime or lemon juice, sugar and soda water.
In Greek mythology, a minotaur was made up of what two creatures?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: man and bull

questions.question: This is how we refer to a person who writes any type of literary products.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Who

questions.question: This 3-headed beast guarded the gates to Hades.
